member.name: M:FluentAssertions.Web.BadRequestAssertions.HaveError(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Asserts that a Bad Request HTTP response content contains an error message identifiable by an expected field name and a wildcard error text.
member.remarks: This assertion considers the HTTP response content a JSON generated by the ASP.NET Core 3.0 framework or less
member.param: The expected field name.
The wildcard pattern with which the error field associated error message is matched, where * and ? have special meanings.
A formatted phrase as is supported by explaining why the assertion is needed. If the phrase does not start with the word because, it is prepended automatically.
Zero or more objects to format using the placeholders in .

member.name: M:FluentAssertions.Web.HttpResponseMessageAssertions.Satisfy``1(``0,System.Action{``0},System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Asserts that an HTTP response content can be a model that satisfies an assertion starting from an inferred model structure.
member.param: A proposed model structure that will help to compose the assertions. This is used to defined the type of the asserted model and it doesn't have to contain other values than the default one.
member.remarks: The assertion can be a single assertion or a collection of assertions if the assertion action is expressed as a statement lambda.
member.param: An assertion or a collection of assertions regarding the given model.
A formatted phrase as is supported by explaining why the assertion is needed. If the phrase does not start with the word because, it is prepended automatically.
Zero or more objects to format using the placeholders in .

member.name: T:FluentAssertions.Web.Internal.TaskExtensions
member.summary: Some unit test frameworks (like xUnit) have their own synchronization context that does not work well with blocking waits and can lead to deadlocks. These methods create the task in the default synchronization context and blocks until the task is completed.

member.name: T:FluentAssertions.HttpResponseMessageFluentAssertionsExtensions
member.summary: Contains extension methods for custom assertions in unit tests.
